title: [Large-Scale] Architectural Science Education Course Design Using Facebook-Based Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of architectural fundamentals and design principles, along with basic comprehension of scientific inquiry methods (observation, hypothesis formulation, experimental design).
context.additional_context: In smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, a collaborative learning environment is constructed using Facebook groups. Learners apply scientific methods (measurement, analysis, evidence collection) during architectural science projects.

learning_goals: Learners develop scientific inquiry skills to improve architectural project solutions by ≥80% through peer feedback and instructor support in a Facebook group.

Learners perform ≥5 collaborative problem-solving activities (variable analysis, hypothesis verification) and share knowledge at each stage of the architectural design process via Facebook group activities.
Learners document ≥4 reflective thinking entries (observation records, evidence-based evaluations) about their architectural design processes through Facebook-based reflective journaling.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
